Subscribe.origin: [Latin subscribere , literally, to write beneath, from sub- under + scribere to write]

sub·scrib·ing.definition: [Latin, literally, to write beneath, fromunder +to write]

1.definition: to sign one's name to a documentto give consent or approval by signing one's name

2 a.definition: to sign (as a document) with one's own hand in token of consent, obligation, or attestation [such witnesses shall the will in the presence of the testator ""]

sub_terms.b: to pledge (a gift or contribution) by writing one's name with the amount
sub_terms.c: to sell (stock) by subscription [over two million shares have been]

2.definition: to agree to purchase and pay for securities esp. of a new offering [a right to to a share of stock "D. Q. Posin"]
